distributional 0.3.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

The Beta distribution

Source: R/dist_beta.R
dist_beta.Rd

dist_beta(shape1, shape2)

Arguments

shape1, shape2

The non-negative shape parameters of the Beta distribution.

See also

stats::Beta

Examples

dist <- dist_beta(shape1 = c(0.5, 5, 1, 2, 2), shape2 = c(0.5, 1, 3, 2, 5))

dist
#> <distribution[5]>
#> [1] Beta(0.5, 0.5) Beta(5, 1)     Beta(1, 3)     Beta(2, 2)     Beta(2, 5)    
mean(dist)
#> [1] 0.5000000 0.8333333 0.2500000 0.5000000 0.2857143
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.12500000 0.01984127 0.03750000 0.05000000 0.02551020
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.000000 -5.916080  2.581989  0.000000  5.962848
kurtosis(dist)
#> [1] -1.5000000  1.2000000  0.0952381 -0.8571429 -0.1200000

generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 3.230922e-01 3.769418e-06 6.019393e-01 5.425518e-01 8.873169e-01
#>  [6] 9.633297e-01 8.567098e-03 3.511410e-01 8.413926e-01 2.710936e-01
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 0.8762181 0.8190241 0.9952975 0.6550031 0.7868358 0.9672802 0.9336062
#>  [8] 0.8592013 0.8513217 0.8680164
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] 0.31767716 0.02539772 0.70044786 0.16849446 0.26874536 0.13153542
#>  [7] 0.00941477 0.03920070 0.08940607 0.39069181
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1] 0.1030762 0.6500007 0.5556616 0.4580443 0.1733643 0.5573321 0.2815270
#>  [8] 0.1895061 0.4099276 0.3735804
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1] 0.22441697 0.13063053 0.46083666 0.05799547 0.04355846 0.10459738
#>  [7] 0.29462663 0.38697430 0.43761593 0.35171325
#> 

density(dist, 2)
#> [1] 0 0 0 0 0
density(dist, 2, log = TRUE)
#> [1] -Inf -Inf -Inf -Inf -Inf

cdf(dist, 4)
#> [1] 1 1 1 1 1

quantile(dist, 0.7)
#> [1] 0.7938926 0.9311499 0.3305670 0.6367425 0.3603577
